metadata.title: CVE-2017-7789 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
If a server sends two Strict-Transport-Security (STS) headers for a singleconnection, they will be rejected as invalid and HTTP Strict TransportSecurity (HSTS) will not be enabled for the connection. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 55.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7789` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '55.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
